author: Ayden Runnels
title: Texas AG Ken Paxton sues TikTok again for explicit content
text:
Ken Paxton files second lawsuit against TikTok for exposing minors to explicit content
[Sign up for The Brief](https://www.texastribune.org/newsletters/the-brief/?utm_medium=website&utm_source=trib-ads-owned&utm_campaign=trib-marketing&utm_term=inline-CTA-brief), The Texas Tribuneâ€™s daily newsletter that keeps readers up to speed on the most essential Texas news.
Texas Attorney General [Ken Paxton](https://www.texastribune.org/directory/ken-paxton/) on Thursday sued TikTok for the second time in recent months, accusing the social media company of violating deceptive trade law by downplaying its addictiveness and exposing children to explicit material.
The suit argues that TikTok, a short-form video app, violated the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act by listing itself on app stores as appropriate for children and not enforcing its community guidelines effectively. The Apple App Store lists TikTok as rated for those 12 and older, while the Microsoft and Google Play Stores list the app as appropriate for users who are 13 and older.
The 66-page filing, which has several redactions, details several TikTok posts containing inappropriate material that seemingly violate the guidelines and ways the app can circumvent parental controls on smartphones through an in-app browser. At one point, the lawsuit states the inappropriate material also included child sexual abuse content, although that section of the suit is largely redacted.
â€œTikTok actively worked to deceive parents and lure children onto their app despite the presence of an overwhelming amount of profane and illicit material,â€ Paxton said in a statement Thursday. â€œCompanies may not jeopardize the health and wellbeing of Texas children by blatantly lying about the products they provide.â€
A spokesperson for TikTok did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Several times the suit references an investigation conducted by the state that found videos which contained depictions of drug use, self-harm and sexually explicit acts. In December, Paxtonâ€™s office [announced](https://www.texasattorneygeneral.gov/news/releases/attorney-general-ken-paxton-launches-investigations-characterai-reddit-instagram-discord-and-other) it would investigate several social media platformsâ€™ privacy and safety practices for children, however the office did not clarify in its announcement Thursday whether the investigation mentioned in the lawsuit was related.
But depending on a ruling from the U.S. Supreme Court, TikTok may not be accessible to anyone in the country for much longer. The platform has stated it would pull all activity from the U.S. on Jan. 19 if the Supreme Court does not strike down a bipartisan law mandating its parent company, ByteDance, sell TikTok.
The Supreme Court is set to hear arguments Friday on the law, which makes it illegal for providers like Apple to have applications available that are owned by foreign adversaries. ByteDance is based in China, and the law was primarily aimed at forcing the TikTok sale. ByteDance is also named in the lawsuit Paxton filed Thursday.
sent weekday mornings.
This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google
[Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy) and
[Terms of Service](https://policies.google.com/terms) apply.
This is the second lawsuit Paxton has filed against TikTok in just over three months, as the attorney generalâ€™s office [filed a suit](https://www.texastribune.org/2024/10/03/ken-paxton-texas-lawsuit-tiktok/) accusing the company of violating the new Securing Children Online through Parental Empowerment Act. [The SCOPE Act](https://capitol.texas.gov/BillLookup/History.aspx?LegSess=88R&Bill=HB18), which has received its own legal challenges, forbids companies from selling a minorâ€™s personal information without parental approval, and the October lawsuit claims TikTok circumvented the law several times. The new lawsuit was filed in the same Galveston federal district as the first suit, and dozens of other lawsuits against social media platforms have been filed across the country in recent years.
Texas lawmakers have weighed bringing restrictions or [outright bans](https://www.texastribune.org/2024/12/05/texas-ban-social-media-as-schools-struggle/) on social media platforms like TikTok for minors as some are exposed to harmful content, but free speech advocacy organizations and tech companies have balked. Several bills have been filed ahead of the 2025 Texas legislative session, one of which could potentially restrict minors from creating accounts on the sites altogether.
Disclosure: Apple, Google and Microsoft have been financial supporters of The Texas Tribune, a nonprofit, nonpartisan news organization that is funded in part by donations from members, foundations and corporate sponsors. Financial supporters play no role in the Tribune's journalism. Find a complete [list of them here](https://www.texastribune.org/support-us/corporate-sponsors/).

author: @theinquisitr
title: Messy Divorce Ahead? Expert Claims Michelle & Barack Obama's Body Language Can't Hide the Signs of Trouble
text:
Former First Lady Michelle Obama and Barack Obama are among the most popular couples. They have set a very high standard in front of the world in terms of partnership and togetherness. The duo has gone through the highest of the highs and lowest of the lows in the public eye like a rock standing by each otherâ€™s side.
Yet, most of 2024 has been hard for Michelle Obama since her absence from Donald Trump â€˜s inaugural ceremony and Jimmy Carterâ€™s funeral sparked alleged divorce rumors between the couple, which, by the way, she dismissed in a bold and authentic conversation.
As per Nicki Swift, the 61-year-old lady made an appearance on the Diary of a CEO podcast explaining that she and Barackâ€™s choice not to broadcast their personal life, like going on dates, had fueled speculation. She noted calmly, â€œWeâ€™re 60â€”youâ€™re not going to know what weâ€™re doing every minute.â€
However, would the media leave a woman no? Hell no! Recently, a body language expert said their recent podcast appearance may have unintentionally confirmed those whispers. She addressed the divorce speculation once again during an episode of her â€œIMOâ€ podcast. Barack joined his wife and her brother, Craig Robinson , in what appeared to be an effort to silence the ongoing rumors.
Happy anniversary, @MichelleObama ! 32 years together, and I couldnâ€™t have asked for a better partner and friend to go through life with. pic.twitter.com/04t41YYfN6
â€” Barack Obama (@BarackObama) October 3, 2024
The subtle cues caught by an expert suggest the couple may have gone through severe marital strain. It all began when the former FLOTUS made a lighthearted yet revealing comment in June. On the show, guest Angie Martinez mentioned Michelle could have had a son. She replied jokingly, â€œIâ€™m so glad I didnâ€™t have a boy. Because he wouldâ€™ve been a Barack Obama.â€
Eagle-eyed fans criticized the comment after which, during the July 16 episode, Barack greeted Michelle with a hug and played along with her brotherâ€™s teasing . â€œShe took me backâ€¦ It was touch and go for a while,â€ Barack joked. But one expert believes there was more truth to that than humor.
Former president Barack Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama addressed speculation about a divorce in her new podcast episode.
â€œShe took me back!â€ Barack Obama joked. â€œIt was touch and go for awhile!â€ https://t.co/nvNE2Ksel5 pic.twitter.com/NQeM43w91W
â€” The Washington Post (@washingtonpost) July 16, 2025
Nicki Swift consulted Traci Brown, a body language expert and behavior analyst, who analyzed the coupleâ€™s conduct in the podcast and said that their â€œtouch and goâ€ joke could actually hint at real past issues. â€œPeople donâ€™t usually say things like that unless thereâ€™s truth behind it,â€ she explained.
Even more telling were her facial expressions. Brown pointed out that Michelleâ€™s blink rate slowed dramatically while discussing the hard times in their marriage, which is an alleged sign of internal sorrow. â€œShe kept her eyes closed while mentioning difficult moments, which signals thereâ€™s more sheâ€™s not saying.â€
Barack and Michelle Obama are now trying to squash rumors that their marriage is on the rocks.
Michelle is so blatantly lying. You can easily tell by the forced delivery.
They should both just admit that their marriage is a total sham.
(pagesix on TT) pic.twitter.com/VN6M5F4uKg
â€” Paul A. Szypula ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@Bubblebathgirl) July 16, 2025
In addition, Traci Brown also highlighted her attempt to shut down divorce talk. â€œThere hasnâ€™t been one moment in our marriage where I have thought about quitting on my man,â€ Michelle said during the podcast. However, Lady Obamaâ€™s twisting of words was telling. â€œShe doesnâ€™t say, â€˜I always wanted to stay with him.â€™ That choice of words shows that leaving him was at least considered,â€ she said.
Meanwhile, in another episode of IMO podcast, she is seen conversing with Julia Louis-Dreyfus about how her life changed since Barackâ€™s Presidential term ended. â€œI mean, at this stage in life for me, personally, is the first time Iâ€™ve been completely free,â€
She continued, â€œThereâ€™s been a release where every choice I make is not about my husband, not about his career, not about my family, not about what my kids need or where theyâ€™re going, itâ€™s totally about me.â€
The couple who have been together since 1992 share two daughters with him. Despite their united front and lighthearted banter, the expert believes thereâ€™s more truth than what Lady Obama tells everyone in front of the camera.
Obama and Michelle married on October 3, 1992. After suffering a miscarriage, Michelle underwent in vitro fertilisation to conceive their daughters Malia Ann (born 1998) and Natasha (known as Sasha, born 2001). The Obama family lived on Chicagoâ€™s South Side, where Barack taughtâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/YSPIteGiLf
â€” AlphaBravoCharlie (@alphabravo1947) January 3, 2024
While the mother of two seems to be thriving in her career even after completing her role as first lady with podcast shows, entrepreneurial ventures, and brand deals, is there nothing going on between Barack and her, or has she gotten better at hiding things, just like all other public figures who face the spotlight every day?

author: AB Newswire
title: Longevi-City: Transforming Urban Living with Longevity and Wellness in the UAE | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Ras-Al-Khaimah, UAE - April 4, 2024 - Longevi-City , the world's first city dedicated to advancing longevity and wellness, has officially launched in the UAE, marking a monumental leap forward in urban development and healthcare innovation.
Under the visionary leadership of His Highness Sheikh Ahmed Bin Faisal Al Qassimi, Longevi- City is reshaping the landscape of urban living with an unwavering commitment to health, wellness, and longevity. Nestled strategically in Ras-Al-Khaimah, Longevi-City offers residents an unparalleled living experience amidst a serene resort-style ambiance and nature-friendly surroundings.
Mr. Dunston Pereira, CEO of the Royal Family Office, shares his vision for Longevi-City, stating, â€œLongevi-City embodies a bold and transformative vision for urban living, where health and wellness are not mere add-ons but integral to every aspect of community life. Our aim is to establish a model for sustainable, healthy, and happy living that inspires cities worldwide.â€
Positioning the UAE as a global leader in longevity and wellness, Longevi-City sets a new standard for cities worldwide. Dr. Raees Tonse, the visionary driving force behind the megaproject and Global Advocate for Longevity and Wellness, highlights the transformative potential of Longevi-City, stating, "Longevi-City represents a movement towards a healthier future for all. By leveraging cutting-edge advancements in healthcare, technology, and community development, it empowers individuals and communities to lead longer, healthier, and more fulfilling lives."
At the core of Longevi-City lies a profound commitment to holistic wellness, which encompasses nurturing not only the physical but also the mental and emotional well-being of its residents. From preventive screenings to specialized treatments, residents have access to comprehensive healthcare services that prioritize early detection and proactive intervention, ensuring their physical health remains optimized.
In addition to exceptional medical care, Longevi-City offers innovative wellness amenities that cater to the diverse needs and preferences of its residents. Whether it's state-of-the-art fitness centers, holistic spas, meditation gardens, or nutrition counseling services, there are ample opportunities for individuals to engage in activities that promote their physical health and vitality.
Longevi-City ensures wellness in every aspect of daily life, from farm-to-table dining experiences highlighting nutritious ingredients to community events promoting mental health awareness and stress management. The city's dedication to sustainability is evident in its eco- friendly architecture, renewable energy usage, and ample green spaces, which encourage physical activity and mental well-being. Residents have access to diverse recreational facilities, including parks and sports complexes, fostering a vibrant lifestyle.
Driven by a profound sense of purpose and an unwavering commitment to advancing human health, Dr. Raees continues to lead by example, inspiring others to join him in the pursuit of a healthier and happier world for all. As Longevi-City forges ahead on its path towards a brighter future, it extends an invitation to investors, organizations, and innovators to join hands in shaping the next frontier of urban wellness. Together, let us build a legacy of longevity, where cities flourish as vibrant hubs of health, happiness, and harmony.

Facebook Company - https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61557484871760
Twitter - @RaeesTonse
Media Contact
Company Name: Longevi-city
Contact Person: Dr Raees Tonse
Email: Send Email
Country: United Arab Emirates
Website: https://www.longevi-city.com

author: IRATI PRAT
title: M. United - Rangers: El Manchester United recurre a la Ã©pica y a un Bruno Fernandes salvador - Europa League
text:
N o tiene partido tranquilo el Manchester United. Ante el Rangers en Europa League, una nueva muestra. Se impusieron 2-1 gracias a un gol de Bruno Fernandes en el descuento despuÃ©s de que el Rangers les empatara en el minuto 88. Son cuartos y dependerÃ¡n de si mismos para clasificar directamente a los octavos.
En una temporada tan complicada como la que estÃ¡ viviendo el Manchester United, los de Amorim se jugaban mucho en casa ante el Rangers. Un 'clÃ¡sico' del fÃºtbol britÃ¡nico que enfrentaba a dos equipos histÃ³ricos de las islas. Y que estuvo muy apretado.
El United empezÃ³ bien. Garnacho, envuelto en rumores de mercado en torno a NÃ¡poles y Chelsea, tuvo la primera. RespondiÃ³ rÃ¡pido el Rangers y Raskin perdonÃ³ en un mano a mano por culpa de un control que se le fue largo. Mientras, Bayindir, hoy titular por delante de Onana, se hacÃ­a grande.
El turco fue uno de los mejores del United y sacÃ³ varias manos de mÃ©rito en el primer tiempo, destacando una ante su compatriota Ridvan Yilmaz al primer palo. La mÃ¡s clara, no obstante, no valÃ­a. AnulÃ³ el VAR un gol de Matthijs de Ligt a la salida de un cÃ³rner por una falta previa de Leny Yoro.
Pero a Amorim, por una vez, le quedaba el comodÃ­n de la fortuna porque si el guiÃ³n del segundo tiempo parecÃ­a que no iba a cambiar... sÃ­ lo hizo gracias a un regalo de Jack Butland. Eriksen sacÃ³ el cÃ³rner y el meta inglÃ©s, ex del United aunque no debutÃ³, se la metiÃ³ en su porterÃ­a con un despeje terrorÃ­fico.
El error de Butland que supuso el 1-0. LAPRESSE. Desde ahÃ­ todo fue cuesta abajo para los 'Red Devils'. Tuvo alguna ocasiÃ³n aislada al Rangers pero el encuentro estaba bajo control. Garnacho tuvo la sentencia tras un jugadÃ³n de Amad Diallo pero la mandÃ³ al palo; Lisandro MartÃ­nez tambiÃ©n pudo anotar, pero esta vez sÃ­ estuvo acertado Butland.
Un final de locura Todo saltÃ³ por los aires al final, cuando los nervios llegaron a los jugadores del United. Primero, hubo susto. Dessers cazÃ³ un balÃ³n al espacio, la picÃ³ sobre Bayindir y se topÃ³ con el poste. La acciÃ³n, eso sÃ­, estaba anulada por fuera de juego. Y ya en el minuto 88, lo que apuntaba a drama: Dessers no perdonaba esta vez tras un error en la marca de Maguire.
Pero Bruno Fernandes acudiÃ³ al rescate. El portuguÃ©s cazÃ³ la espalda a su marcador y anotÃ³ el 2-1 tras un grandÃ­simo centro de Lisandro MartÃ­nez. Era el gol de la victoria y llegaba en el minuto 92. Amorim, al lÃ­mite.
El luso, no obstante, ha ganado sus tres partidos como tÃ©cnico del Manchester United en Europa League. Y ya son cuartos, con 15 puntos. CerrarÃ¡n la 'fase liga' en Bucarest (ante el FCSB, que es octavo) y dependen de si mismos para 'saltarse' el 'playoff'.

author: The Weather Authority App
title: New technology offers non-surgical skin cancer treatment - NewsBreak
text:
WKRC
website
Cincinnati
New technology offers non-surgical skin cancer treatment
By The Weather Authority App,
1 hours agoCINCINNATI (WKRC) - As the warmer months approach, dermatologists are emphasizing the importance of skin protection. Dr. Elizabeth Muennich of Dermatology and Skin Care Associates highlighted the potential harm of sun exposure, saying, "You just have to be careful and sun protect. It's a combination of environment and sun exposure so. If you're out in the sun and not using good sunscreen, you're definitely at higher risk."
1
